unit: Unit 9 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Slopes
title: General Hypotheses
question_text: Suppose you are told you will do a two-sided $t$-test for slope. Which are the correct hypotheses when written out in words?

choices.text:
$H_{0}$: There is an association between the given two variables.
$H_{a}$: There is no association between the given two variables.

$H_{0}$: There is no association between the given two variables.
$H_{a}$: There is an association between the given two variables.

$H_{0}$: There is no association between the given two variables.
$H_{a}$: There is a positive association between the given two variables.

$H_{0}$: There is no association between the given two variables.
$H_{a}$: There is a negative association between the given two variables.

$H_{0}$: There is an association between the given two variables.
$H_{a}$: The association between the given two variables is positive.
